Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION AND VALUE”
Reviews.Author: gsvon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in total over the period of the month in Canada. The first room - 503 - was a bit noisy being on the road but after that the other rooms (2nd 610 and 3rd 712) we stayed in (a total of 3) were all away from the road and were great. The last one with our son we had separate bedrooms but shared the one bathroom(712). The staff were so helpful with all our questions about Vancouver. Loved how central this was and so close to the waterfront and the station so we could get the sky train from the airport to the waterfront and walk to the hotel. Likewise going to North Vancouver to Grouse Mountain was all within walking distance to the station to the Seabus to the bus to Grouse Mountain and then back again the same. Close to all the city amenities including Gastown and Canada Place. The breakfast you get a $10 voucher for and you end up paying a little more than that with taxes and tips but a good meal. Smiley's Pub next door has a great atmosphere, great staff and good meals. They are so big you can share.

Reviews.Title: “I'd Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: goehringw
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our return from Whistler. We had a single room and a double. Both were clean, nicely furnished and had comfortable beds. This is not a fancy hotel but suited us fine. We got a great rate through the company website.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be beat for location and price!”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler48962
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very clean and well kept. The beds are very comfortable and nice. Location is a little noisy but it is very convienent.

Reviews.Title: “Really handy to downtown, staff rather rude”
Reviews.Author: Sarah T
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you are wanting to be close to downtown and the Waterfront station from the airport is about 4-5 blocks away so walking distance. I was really happy when we arrived and I enquired about an upgrade and was given one for free. However the lady that was checking us in kept looking at her watch and then stopped checking us in half way through because her shift had finished and someone else came and checked us in, she could have finished checking us in before leaving, it was very rude. The room came with free wi-fi and free bottled water each day. The room is very basic but everything we needed. On checking out we had the same lady who checked us in at the start and she had a conversation with people behind us the whole time and barely even acknowledged us, this staff member was so rude at check in and check out.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, great location”
Reviews.Author: Carrie W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights for a yoga conference at the Vancouver Convention Centre. Great location, about 2 blocks to VCC and walking distance to restaurants and shopping downtown. Also easy access to Skytrain (Canada Line) to the airport and other public transportation. The rooms are small and the building a little quirky, but everything was spotlessly clean, nice cozy bedding, lots of pillows and comfortable beds. Most rooms have no view- ie: cement wall outside our window as the hotel is flanked by buildings on both sides, but it almost guarantees its going to be quiet, it was very quiet our entire stay. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The restaurant downstairs in the hotel had a good breakfast special and is very convenient. Good value in a great location. Would stay here again and recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “"Definitely would come back!"”
Reviews.Author: Rio_Calgarian
Reviews.Content: Attended a seminar and stayed for 2nights in this hotel which has a great location(walking distance to everything-especially the Skytrain 2blocks away) clean hotel, attentive staff. The General Manager (Ish Awan) is so accomodating and making sure that everything is ok. Rio - Calgary

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay! Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: mlee0707
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights last week and really enjoyed it. First, the location in unbeatable. It's a 10-minute walk to the Skytrain, Canada Place and the waterfront, and a 15-minute walk to Robson Street. The room was small, but it was clean and that's what mattered. The bathroom was a nice size as well and had a window, which was nice. We got there hours before check-in and they had a room available for us. I read reviews of this place where people complained about the elevator being slow and small, and while it is tiny, we never had to wait for it. Maybe it's because we were there during shoulder season and it was just the two of us, but I don't think we shared the elevator with anyone else during our entire stay. The front desk and valet were incredibly nice and helpful. My only complaint is the nighttime desk employee who gave us very vague directions when I asked her for directions to the nearest Skytrain station, since we were going to take that to the airport the next morning. Her, pointing west: "It's about two blocks that way and then up a little ways." Me: What's the name of the station? Her: Oh, it's the last stop. Ummm, yeah, not helpful. Seeing as though we're staying in a hotel, I think it's safe to assume that we're VISITING and do not know the names of the stations or the train lines. I rolled my eyes and went to bed and asked the morning-shift employee who said, "You go out the front door and make a left. Go about two blocks to Granville and turn left, and the station called Canada Line will be right in front of you. Take it to southbound to the YVR stop, which is the airport." Thank you! Now really, was that so hard? Besides that little hiccup, I have absolutely no complaints about the Days Inn Downtown Vancouver. It's walking distance to everything. You can do what we did: walk to the waterfront, take the Sea Walk all the way to -- and through -- Stanley Park, then walk to Robson Street and hang out/people watch/shop/eat/drink then walk back to the hotel. It's an entire day but well worth the experience. Also, check out Joey on Burrad, a bar/grill a hop, skip and a jump from the hotel that does a great job of maintaining a hip, cool vibe without it being too trendy or pretentious.

Reviews.Title: “Well Sited, Comfortable for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: mcavty
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of downtown close by tourist attractions, waterfront & cruise ship terminals, this hotel is value for money. Staff attentive to guests needs, tho free wifi not available. Good cooked breakfast available for reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, COMFORTABLE STAY”
Reviews.Author: BernieM1950
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Days Inn on West Pender St, Vancouver on two occasions. This hotel is almost 100 years old, but it is obvious that every effort has been taken to make this hotel as comfortable as possible, given its age. The rooms are reasonably well appointed, the beds are comfortable. The staff at Days were fantastic. The Chelsea restaurant downstairs was superb. The two folk managing the restaurant were unbelievable. The quality of the food was excellent. The location of Days is ideal for people who want easy access to Gastown, Cruise Terminal and downtown Vancouver. A shuttle is available, for client convenience, within the central area of Vancouver, but does not go across the bridge to Granville Island for example, but that's fine. We would certainly stay there again. Thank you to all the staff at Days who made our visit so pleasurable.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware of high parking price!”
Reviews.Author: JustBeingHonest85
Reviews.Content: I come up to Vancouver often from Seattle and the hotel charges around $33 for parking per night!! I rented a car for $12 a day through Priceline, I can't justify how parking can be more expensive than my rental?? They only offer valet service and parking is off site. I found a cheaper lot near Richards and Pender...Easypark I believe... for $15 a night, it's even less on weekends...it's only a 10 minute safe walk back to the hotel. If you do your research before you come here, you can find some alternative parking. I'd much rather save an extra $17 per day so I can use that money for lunch, dinner etc...I stayed at the Ramada up the street and they only charged me $15 for parking plus taxes...I was quite disappointed....I can justify the Hyatt or Fairmont charging $33+ for parking, but not for a budget friendly chain. Other than that, the staff were friendly, the rooms were clean, and free wii-fii! Not much in terms of ammenities, just a basic place to stay if you need to sleep. I found the location to be prime, it's a short 5 minute walk to the convention centre, and only 10 minutes to Robson Street and Pacific Center.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: mikeandmickey
Reviews.Content: We recently (Sept 2011) stayed at the Days Inn in downtown Vancouver. We had a very positive experience. The room was clean, they let us check in early at no additional charge also. We came off a cruise ship and were able to walk to the hotel, it was that close to the pier, luggage and all. The desk staff were friendly, and polite and the room was clean. If you need to stay in the downtown port area this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “A tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: bshavels
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location - a short walk to Vancouver's waterfront, the center of most tourist activity. But the hotel shows its age. The single, crowded elevator is inadequate to the demand, especially since guest arrive in bunches as they come and go from cruise ships. Our electronic keys were very difficult to use, both for access to the elevator and to enter our room. Our original room, #605, was tiny and, if the bathroom door was left open, the bed faced the toilet bowl. We objected politely and were rewarded with a suite at no extra charge. This was a huge change for the better, allowing us and our friends to convene comfortabley for a cocktail before heading out to dinner. Overall, the place is bland, the furniture often chipped or stained, and the rooms and halls lack any visual attraction. Oddly, there were two tvs in our suite, one in each room, but the only phone was in the second room. The downstairs restaurant was just ok for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “JUST OK”
Reviews.Author: goldspot
Reviews.Content: Our family of 10 stayed at this hotel pre-cruise in July 2011. The rooms were very small the doors did not close properly. The air conditioners did not fully cool off the rooms. You could hear seagulls perched outside in the mornings.This was originally an old hotel poorly renovated. Don't think it measures up to current Days Inn Standards. Restaurant downstairs for breakfast was ok. Had a long wait for elevator. Shuttle was good to take us down to cruise terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Binnidm
Reviews.Content: Location was convenient to downtown, Gastown, and the Cruise Center

Reviews.Title: “Great handy place to stay prior to a cruise”
Reviews.Author: J0hanna7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Aug. 7 to 10, 2011 precruise. We had enough points for one free night and paid for the other 2 nights. It was a most convenient hotel to stay in order to enjoy the many attractions in Vancouver such as the 2 day trolley tour we took. The hotel itself is fine if you are flying in. Not sure about parking but there are many parking places in the area. Not cheap though. We were put on the 7th floor but the elevator was prompt. You had to use your room card to enter it from the lobby. The room had a double bed, closet, bathroom with just shower. No free "start the day" breakfast such as the other Days Inns in smaller towns. It did have free WIFI which was great for us. It did have a coffee maker and what we used was always replenished. So were the soaps, shampoos, etc. in the bathroom. The receptionists at the front desk were very pleasant and helpful. The room was clean and kept that way. Check in and check out was prompt. We were just 3-1/2 blocks from Canada Place so we walked there (it houses the cruise terminal) and was downhill. There was a convention in the area with thousands of graphic designers and we were fortunate that we booked far enough ahead as some on the ship had trouble getting accommodation at a reasonable price and ended up spending double we did. The hotel does have a restaurant which is open for breakfast and lunch - not dinner but there are many restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay- Rescued from Attacker”
Reviews.Author: Ashleyloves2travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in February of 2011. This is an older hotel that has been very well renovated and looks stunning! Clean, bright lobby. Check in was smooth. Very friendly and welcoming staff that were very knowledgeable about the city. Room was great- clean and tidy. Washroom was perfect and looked new. Consistent pressure and temperature. Nice towels and sheets- they did not cheap out. Free Wi-Fi in the hotel, which worked flawless. Room had TV with decent channel line-up and a mini fridge that was whisper quiet. Safe in room is a good idea. Close to Sky Train stations! The hotel is in an area that is pretty safe, and having lived in Vancouver previously for a year- I knew what to expect. This was a good area in a safe neighborhood... however a freak accident really set this hotel, staff and its guests apart from any other stay. I had just gotten back from meetings and was taking a taxi back... the taxi overshot the hotel and dropped my off on the other side of Hornby St. I was walking back with my laptop case over my shoulder and was steps away from the hotel. I guess I was watching a man pushing something down the street that I did not see what happened, but some low life hooligan threw me to the ground an kicked me in the leg and tried grabbing my laptop bag. It had wound itself around my arm so this person was trying to rip my arm off to get my laptop. I tried in vein to push the bag off my arm while screaming for help that seemed an eternity... finally the bag came off and the thug was gone, but next thing I know the thug is being attacked on the street in front of the hotel. Guests and staff came streaming out of the hotel doors and the wannabe thug is being attacked himself. I see him and several people run off. I remember a staff member, male, in uniform lifting me off the sidewalk and helping me to the hotel. I don't remember his name or face... but thank God for him. They brought me to the lobby. Several people from the Lounge had heard about the robbery and came out to my defense. Next thing I know a person in a cowboy hat with rolled up sleeves brings me my laptop. He did not have to risk his life for it. Another staff member called Police and several officers came by. I went to stay with friends in Kamloops that night. A co-worker checked me out in the morning. I never got a chance to say thank-you to the staff member that helped me or the other guests at the hotel that came to my aid, and the cowboy that retrieved my computer. I sent a letter to the manager praising his night employees. This is a nice hotel in a good area, but like any downtown big city- you need to stay street wise, and make sure you know what is going on around you. I do not in any way blame the attack on the hotel and credit them for their quick- thinking staff members.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: cyclone92
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, one before and one after a cruise. It is incredibly convenient to get to from the airport -- just take the canada line until the very last stop (waterfront station) and it is 2-3 blocks away. Getting to the Canada Place terminal is equally convenient, about 3 blocks. The rooms were very clean and we had no issues with them. The beds were comfortable, rooms quiet, and we all slept well. The only thing you should be aware of is that some rooms are MUCH larger than others. We booked two rooms with double beds and each time one of the rooms was significantly larger than the other. If you are going to be staying here for an extended stay, make sure you get one of the larger rooms. The value is by far the best for the downtown area. All the other hotels in the area were well out of our price range. We will definitely stay again if we are every back in the Vancouver area.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Value in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: kaieisle
Reviews.Content: I stayed in at this Days Inn for one week while attending a conference at the Convention Centre. If you're someone who doesn't need the luxury "extras" then this is a great place to stay! The location was amazing: 2 minute walk to the Convention Centre, 5-7 minute walk to shopping on Robson, 4 minutes to the Seawall, and 10-ish minutes to the center of Gas Town. The free wi-fi throughout the hotel made it perfect for business, and the proximity to great restaurants, bars, and nightlife was excellent. I will say that this is NOT a romantic or luxurious place, but it's clean and the staff were very friendly. I was in a "double double" room (#606) that did not have any views, but that was okay because it was quiet and like I said, I was there for business and not in the room too much anyway. As an added bonus, Smiley's Irish Pub next door is FANTASTIC! Some of the best calamari I've ever had in my life, great beer selection, and cool atmosphere. Definitely not the kind of place you'd expect to be semi-attached to a Days Inn! Overall great value for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is good and close to the convention centre”
Reviews.Author: SteveBGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel when i attended a conference at the convention centre. I have stayed in this hotel 3 times now (for the same reason). It is about 5 mins walk to the centre from the hotel. The hotel is cheaper than the others near the convention centre but is a fine place to stay. It is a fairly standard hotel. rooms are fine, nothing out of the ordinary. The irish bar in the hotel is a good place to get a drink and doesnt cause any noise in the hotel. good place to stay and i will stay here again next time i come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: superjem
Reviews.Content: We got the skytrain from the train station to our hotel which was about a 5 min walk away. Very good location and due to other reviews we did not have breakfast at the hotel. Instead we took advantage of the many coffee shops within close walking distance which was brilliant and less money than the hotel breakfast. We had bottled water every day although dont leave the bottle in the fridge with a tiny amount in as they wont give you another one!There was a computer with printer in the lobby so were able to print our boarding cards!I We were on the top floor facing the road so were a little hesitant about outside noise but in actual fact it was fine - until the morning!! The cleaners have a staff room on the top floor that has their washing machines etc in it so we were woken every morning with the staff coming to work, chatting outside our room while they were waiting for the lift and then the noise of their big trolleys being pushed into the lift! They were in no way quiet what so ever and had no respect for visitors who were most probably asleep at 7am. However, the hotel was clean, comfortable and good value and would definitley stay again but would request not to be located near the staff room!! can only imagine what it woudl have been like to be located immediately next to or underneath it!

Reviews.Title: “Good value,better location.”
Reviews.Author: Tytaany
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently in this Days Inn on a mini vacayion to visit Vancouver and environs. Although this is a small property and somewhat dated it has been renovated in the early part of 00''s. Our room was spacious and well appointed, including a small fridge. The hotel has a European flavour with one small elevator serving the 8 floors. The staff was very courteous and helpful ( I had made an error on my reservation). There is a small restaurant in the lower level for breakfast. Although we chose to go to one of the many food courts for breakfast. The hotel is located 2 blocks from the harbour and is close to the new convention centre. All in all our stay was most enjoyable. My only caution would be parking. Although the hoteloffers valet parking elsewhere, we opted for self parking in adjacent buildings. It was a bit of a nightmare. Each lot having its own automated machine and tickets. My advice, hold your breath,read the screen on the machine attentively (there may be a second page) and read the ticket. It may go with you,it may stay in the car or you may use it to pay for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice little budget hotel in the best location”
Reviews.Author: Daradai
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights at the Days Inn Vancouver Downtown and had a fantastic time. The hotel are very clean, comfortable , well decorated & comfy beds. Located a few blocks from the Canada Place & Vancouver Convention centre, within walking distance to Robson street , Shopping Mall and Gas Town. The complimentary free Wifi is great. We had a good time staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, a great value for a comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: SLM57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vancouver Days Inn for one night following a cruise. I was very pleased with the value I received. I booked a rate online which included a breakfast voucher. The location is excellent. 2 blocks from the cruise terminal and the transit station(s), 2 blocks from Gastown, walking distance to anywhere in downtown. Free Wifi is included and the front desk staff are very friendly and helpful. Yes, the rooms are a little smaller than most American hotels, but are on a par with most European hotels. I did not feel cramped at all. We enjoyed our short stay at the Days Inn.

Reviews.Title: “I would like to thank the Manager, Ish Awan.”
Reviews.Author: Adearthic
Reviews.Content: I lost my passport somewhere in customs, and had to spend a few days downtown, close to the embassies. Mr Awan was most helpful to me, even offering his own computer for my use, as my iphone was stolen as well. The hotel was a lifeline to me in the midst of a nasty jam. Thank you Mr Awan.

Reviews.Title: “SMALL”
Reviews.Author: RDSchro
Reviews.Content: Pros: The rooms are clean. Great helpful staff. Good location between Robson St and the waterfront. Free WiFi Big TV Price avg $100/night Cons: Postage stamp sized rooms No Table There would not be enough room to have 2 people in the room at one time! The a/c/heater unit is loud and blocks your sightline. If you do book a room, make sure to ask for a street view room. All the other rooms have windows but they all look out to a concrete wall! Very closterphobic enviroment.

Reviews.Title: “not quite what I expected...”
Reviews.Author: BizDevRoadee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, right in downtown, within walking distance to the waterfront and convention center, and a great pub right nextdoor. The hotel is in an old building, small old elevator, small little rooms, but a nice big LCD t.v.. The "restaurant" was tiny and a bit overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn on West Pender gives quality for less.”
Reviews.Author: futuredirector
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I stayed just one night while attending our Mary Kay conference at Canada Place conference center. Two VERY comfortable regular beds and complimentary decaf and regular coffee....also water..; Clean hot shower and good temperature control in the room. Our room was quiet. The elevator had security. We were a short 5 minute walk to our conference. Complementary map. Wake up call. Soooo impressed because all the other hotels in the area were considerably more expensive. Smart to have the 14 day early reservation (best price) but there were other options online to include breakfast or redeem sky train tickets. Days Inn staff were efficient. They gladly stowed our luggage while we attended the conference. Kudos.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base For Exploring Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Tommy_Headbutt
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at the Days Inn Vancouver Downtown on Feb 20th, 2011 to celebrate our 3rd anniversary as a couple. We were in Vancouver for the day, looking to do a bit of shopping & sightseeing, and have a nice walk along the harbor by Canada Place. We needed a hotel that was close to Robson Street, ideally a little closer to the water, and we had a tight budget. We didn't need a pool, a gym, or anything extra beyond a nice, comfortable sleep. The Days Inn hit the spot on all of those criteria, so we booked ourselves in for a night. We arrived by SkyTrain (Canada Line), which had a stop very close by (just a few blocks' walk). We walked into a cozy (yep, I guess that means "small") lobby, and were greeted immediately by the friendly front desk agent, who had us checked in within about 2 minutes. Very quick. As we headed to the elevator, the porter showed us a few quick tips on how to use the key card. We were impressed that he took the time to show us. Whether or not we actually "needed" the advice, I don't know, but we followed his instructions and had no problems, so we'll give him the benefit of the doubt. It was a nice gesture, regardless. Our room had a nice "urban" view. No, that doesn't mean we were looking into the office building next door. We actually had a very pleasant view down one of the roads (Burrard???) onto some two- or three-story tall piece of modern art (had some modern looking blocks that moved up and down every few minutes). The hotel was close to Canada Place, so we went for a nice little walk in that area, past the Olympic torch and down into the harbour. We returned via Robson Street, which was buzzing with activity, as usual. We booked a meal at The Keg restaurant, which was a few blocks from the hotel. After the meal, we returned to the room for a little shut eye. The room was very clean. We watched a little TV before bed. The hotel had a new flat screen LCD TV, and a nice little dock for my iPod to charge. It didn't charge my iPhone 4 (not compatible) but that's not a negative in any way... just an extra little nicety that didn't work out. The Internet was free, so that more than made up for it. Our sleep was completely peaceful. Our room was almost next door to the elevator, and we didn't hear a thing. We didn't hear traffic either. Nothing! It was very good. The bed was very comfortable, especially the nice and heavy duvet. We requested a late checkout (12 noon) - no problems. Checkout itself took about 20 seconds. We had no incidentals, so that certainly helped. For what we were looking for, the Days Inn Downtown was perfect for us. A peaceful night's sleep in a clean hotel, close to attractions. If you're looking for a luxury stay, this might not be your hotel, but if you're looking for a nice little budget hotel in a good location - you can't go wrong at the Days Inn. Hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: “Was a good place to be downtown for the price.”
Reviews.Author: oldehawk
Reviews.Content: Was downtown to see the Eric Clapton concert and needed a room for the night was able to get one the same day. Rooms are small but for a one nighter it was just fine. Staff was friendly and the resturant for breakfast was a good value and tasted good too

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal for the Location”
Reviews.Author: PallSW
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference at the convention center and needed a hotel that was affordable and close to the conference. I was pleasantly pleased with the location. The hotel room was clean and the staff was very friendly. I also enjoyed having the complimentary shuttle downtown. I also had breakfast in Chelsea's downstairs at the food was great and huge servings. I definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe their "best rate guarantee"!!!”
Reviews.Author: LuGoFe
Reviews.Content: I booked a night at this hotel trough their own website because they said they would guarantee the lowest rate found (I always prefer booking straight with the hotel to guarantee...). Now, 5 days later, I'm still fighting to get them to meet the lowest rate I found on the web. Not only they are not meeting the lowest price, they had the HIGHEST!!! UNBELIEVABLE! Now I can't even cancel the booking because they say I bought it in advance. Of course I did, so I'd have to time to make changes on my plans as necessary. I will NEVER book at this hotel again. EVER! And I do not recommend believing in ANYTHING they advertise. Incredibly unsatisfied with their costumer service.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location for Business & Pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: dforce
Reviews.Content: I love staying at the Days Inn in Vancouver. The location can't be beat! I arrived by float plane from Victoria and enjoyed a short walk to the hotel. I was in town for a conference and didn't feel like paying outrageous conference hotel rates. The Days Inn was just two blocks to the conference which is convenient enough for me and I got a great rate which was a fraction of the conference hotel rate. Although it is located in Vancouver's financial district which is perfect for business, it is highly accessible to Robson Street and Pacific Centre - just a few blocks again - for shopping or dining during the evenings! Being just a couple of blocks from Robson or the Waterfront makes this an ideal spot for tourists. Leave the car at home, you won't need it! But the absolute best part is the incredible value. The price is reasonable and all of the staff are courteous and attentive. The rooms are modern, clean, and spacious complete with 37" flat screen televisions! I was upgraded to a suite and loved having the sofa, microwave, and mini fridge. The mini fridge even included free bottled water! I also love that it's not a business hotel that 'nickels and dimes' you to pay for internet like the higher end brands - it's free! Even though you're right in the heart of downtown, the location is extremely quiet because it's in the financial district....but you're never too far away from the action. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. As far as I'm concerned, this is my permanent home when in Vancouver for business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Super convenient!”
Reviews.Author: Dara123
Reviews.Content: This is a basic days inn. No frills people. BUT, it was clean, and located in the right place. It was in downtown Vancouver, accessible by all busses, within walking distance to all the shops, and to Granville Street with all the pubs and clubs. Clean white sheets, comfortable blankets, and the bathroom was spotless. The room was tiny, but I didn't come to Vancouver to see the inside of a hotel room. There's also a small fridge in the room, and they stock it with complementary bottled water. I was concerned about which Vancouver hotel to book, but for the price and location you can't go wrong with the Days Inn.

Reviews.Title: “It's downtown...it's cheap for downtown...it's ok but...”
Reviews.Author: geoqwest
Reviews.Content: I grabbed a room at the Days Inn downtown at the last minute as I had a meeting at a clients office in the next block. I had checked people in for my company at the Days Inn during the 1980's and 1990s as it was the most reasonable cost hotel in the downtown core. It still is. It's old. There is no hiding it. That's not by default a bad thing. It can be charming and mmemorable. They have done a great job to try to keep it retro-ed and updated. But there is only so much you can do. My room was small. Most seem to surround the elevator doors and the noise that comes with middle aged, middle management folks cut loose in the city on an expense account to go to a conference a couple of blocks away at the Trade and Convention Centre can be an issue. I was in room 303(?) with the bright light outside the window illuminating the front street sign outside my window. Other than being woken up as the post dinner meeting crowd tumbling out of the elevator 3 metres from my door at 11 pm, I woke up repeatedly thinking it was a sunny day in Vancouver as the outside lamp burned holes around the curtains all night. Breakfast cost $20. I checked out in the AM with a $200 bill (inc breakfast, off season Oct 4 2010). I think that's a deal for the Vancouver downtown core. But I prefer a short Skytrain ride to the burbs and a nicer hotel with big rooms and modern facilities for less than half the price. If staying downtown is your preference and you are not looking for an epic hotel experience and you are looking to save a few bucks by finding a cheap downtown hotel, the Days Inn is OK. I'm not fussy in hotels. I travel over 200 days a year. Hotels are for me are pure utility. Sleep, food, clean, internet, quiet... at a decent price. Forget the spa and aroma therapy and bed turndown service (I like to lie in bed in my tighty whities watching TV usually when the nice lady knocks on the door to turn down the bed. It's not a pleasant visual. Don't dwell on it). For $3.75 and a 20 minute Skytrain ride, you'll save a hundred bucks a night and have a great sleep (see my review on La Quinta in Richmond).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BelindaSt_Augustine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night following our cruise. The front desk staff were very friendly and accomodated our early arrival. They were helpful with dining, transportation and area information. Great location for exploring downtown Vancouver. Clean and comfortable. The down points were no views, a window a/c unit, and one small elevator.

Reviews.Title: “It is pretty good for the price I paid”
Reviews.Author: rokksol
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located in a very good part of downtwon. Walking distance from the Vancouver Harbour and English Bay. We only stayed there for one night since we were just roaming around BC. We did not have the chance to try the restaurant downstairs but it look like a very good setup. The lobby is pretty small so after check out and waiting for a taxi there were barelys any seats to wait at. There is no GYM, sauna, etc howevre, there is a YMCA and Steve Nash SSport Centre facility nearby. Again the location was great. it is a block away from Granville Street and they always have lots going on. "we got to see Finger Eleven doing a public presentation" that was neat for anybody that knows FingerEleven. What I did notice that did not like for sure it is how noisy traffic can be downtown and how thin the walls were. We could here people closing and opening doors in the Hallway and the only way to neutralized this was by turning on the AC. Bathrooms were decent. The room overall was very clean and I had two queen beds in the room and we still had room to walk around them. TV was a flat screen. It had a mini fridge and the internet signal strenght was good as well. Finally, for how much I paid for that night I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Canada Place”
Reviews.Author: catsforkids
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the price and location. The rooms come in all kinds of sizes. Each of our four rooms had a different size and layout. The staff at the front desk were very friendly, helpful and accommodating (we had a very small room by the elevator and requested a change which they granted us). So we all had rooms toward the back of the hotel, away from Pender Street which gave us a quieter night. The rooms were clean and the beds very comfortable. Restaurants in all directions from the hotel. Stanley Park is a nice 1 mile walk away. I would HIGHLY recommend going there and renting bikes. The hotel offers a free shuttle to Canada Place, but it is so close and downhill, we walked with our luggage in tow. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: 92Wanderlust
Reviews.Content: Hotel was close to the Sky Train and Canada Place where we were able to get on the Hop On Hop Off bus. Currancy exchange a block down the street. Loved having two rooms with two TVs for each kid! Only negative I can say is that we could hear all of the noices from outside.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Yorky201024
Reviews.Content: At the end of our month long road trip around British Columbia and Alberta, we chose this hotel for our few days in Vancouver before we flew back to the UK. The room was compact and the view out of the window was the wall of the building opposite, but it was clean and well decorated, and comfortable. The staff were very polite and helpful, there was free wi-fi. The breakfasts were of good quality and value

Reviews.Title: “Room left much to be desired”
Reviews.Author: Mncherokee
Reviews.Content: We booked the reservation for 5 people and the room only had sleeping for 4 (2 double beds). We were told there were no cots available so my teenager put some chairs together to sleep on. The air conditioning did not work and we could not open the windows because there were no screens on the windows. The room key cards were iffy at best (did not work in the elevator very well). The food was ok. Location was good (need the pier where we needed to board the cruise ship) and there was free internet access in the lobby. The room was way overpriced (over twice what a room with one double bed cost).

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, basic no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: JVJ805
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one nite prior to boarding cruise. Nice girls in reception but I think the porter was having a bad day, quiet rude, both to reception and clients. Next day different guy and much improved attitude. The room we got was quite big however it only had a double bed, which is too small for my husband and I. The lobby was small and on the morning of departure there were quite a few people and lots of bags all waiting for the courtesy bus to the cruise terminal. There is a small restaurant down stairs, food was ok and owners very nice. A positive is that it is very central location to shopping district. If you are on a tighter budget this hotel would be ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jkloc
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel on-line and read all the reviews. I paid $144 total. It is several blocks from the end of the Sky Train, but we managed to schlup our luggage that far. Check in and out was perfect. Nice hotel, very clean, new feel. No view - didn't care. Our two bed room was actually two connected double rooms - nice. Great location near Sky Train and not far from the ferry terminal, art museum, etc. Provided a free shuttle to the cruise terminal. Nice deal.

Reviews.Title: “Outrageous extra taxes”
Reviews.Author: Pattipureheart
Reviews.Content: The room was ok, staff was ok, the elevator was terrible, you need to use your room key and it never works, so you constantly have to get the staff to get it to work. BUT the worst was the after taxes they don't tell you about, the room was $139/night and the taxes were over $80/night, 21% parking tax?? After paying $22/night for parking?? 10% room tax?? after paying gst?? We will never stay there again. Definitely not worth the money. Would have been better to go to a luxury hotel where the taxes are part of the nightly rate. They have wifi, but so slow, took forever to even check email.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: nichnaimhsi
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in the day and the hotel staff were quite helpful in holding our bags for us until our room became ready later in the day, which allowed us to explore the city without worrying about our things. The room was perfect, with two seperate sleeping areas and a shared bathroom. My only complaint was that it was a little cold! It was clean and comfortable though which was all we wanted though, as most of the time we were out sightseeing. There was plently of food and shopping options within walking distance (a few blocks away maybe) and a bar next door. It had a cover charge during the day for a sport match and that night was the same for the music. We did go here as it was a Saturday night but left after one drink as the music was, in my opinion, awful!! Great hotel overall, I'd go back!

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Vancouvers most economical hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: turtlepics
Reviews.Content: Wow... we were pleasantly surprised. The staff was extremely helpful & accomadting . The restaraunt was good & beds were second to none. Rooms were small but well appointed. Cozy and comfortable . The shower was wonderful. Best of all, location, location, location !!! You can walk everywhere from here & if you don't want to, take the complementary shuttle. No need to worry they have it covered here. If you like history this is the place. I would stay here again any day :}

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Miche03
Reviews.Content: I have a hard time sleeping in hotels and motels and i was very pleasantly surprised about this hotel. After reading some of the negative reviews I was a little hesitant to stay there for 3 nights (the length of my trip). When we got there it was at 1am, the front desk was a little rude. After we checked in, we went to the elevator (very small) got off the 7th floor which reeked. The bed was comfortable, the room was very clean and the smell eventually went away. The only thing is be careful when you turn on the hot water! It get really hot. It's very centrally located where everything is just a short walk away. You can take the Canada line from the airport to Waterfront, get out and walk like 3 blocks and you're at the hotel. Very easy to find. I really did enjoy this hotel and hope you will share the same positive experience as i had.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: iwk2travel
Reviews.Content: I had never been to Vancouver and didn't know what to expect. I looked at so many reviews for hotels and area's to stay. Finally thanks to my Windom rewards I chose this hotel to use my free night stay because it was within walking distance of Canada Place. We arrived the day before sailing out on Holland America. This hotel was only a few blocks from Canada Place and also offered a shuttle to the dock., expect about a 20 min wait for the shuttle to get there. It also offered shuttle service to Stanley Park (which arrived quickly) and Gas Town (it also included other places but those were the ones we were interested in). We took a limo from the airport which had a set rate of $40 for 4 people to the hotel where a taxi would have been much more because the meter is always running. The Limo driver also pointed out places of interest along the way. Once we checked in we took the elevator to our room, the elevator is a bit small but the bellman was right behind us with our luggage. The room was set up as two rooms with double beds in each section. This was nice traveling with a teenager who needs his space. The front desk was also helpful in suggesting places to eat and see. We accidently missed a trail in Stanley park to go see lions gate bridge and walked all the way around the park it felt like 7 miles. The hotel was within walking distance of the park and then we walked to gastown from the hotel for dinner. In the morning they held out luggage until we were ready to head to the dock to go on the ship. The staff was very friendly and helpful even knowing that we were staying there for free. I did not see on site parking, but didn't have to worry about that. It offers free internet. It does not offer continental breakfast but there is a restaurant on site. It sits between lots of bigger buildings but I would stay here again and also recommend it even at a paying price. I had read other reviews of this being near a bad area of town and I did not experince anything of that nature especially walking back from Gastown at night.

Reviews.Title: “Expect to be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: wayne93
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location 3 days and it was to much.I have travelled to over 60 countries in 10 years.The room I was assigned to was tiny and dark with a beautiful view ( a wall !!!!), and we had bugs next time I would sleep in the street!!!! And the Valet but Clyde or Clive whatever wasn't very helpful he didn't help me with my luggage, he was hidding in his spot and having fun with his laptop that's nice. I had to carry all my luggage by myself.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations for the price we booked it for -- with one caveat.”
Reviews.Author: lunachik
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay at the Days Inn Vancouver with my husband and his younger brother. Upon check-in we were pleasantly surprised by the spacious, well-kept (if dark) rooms. Everything was entirely adequate, aside from a surprise valet parking charge on arrival. However, upon check-out we asked if we could leave our rental vehicle in the spot the valet attendant parked it in (outside the front door) while we had a quick breakfast before leaving Vancouver. The receptionist agreed and we left for 45 minutes. Upon returning, the car had been towed! Fortunately the impound lot was not too far away and the hotel agreed to pay some of the cost (but not all, because we had technically assumed responsibility for the car when we were given back our keys). Bottom line: I recommend the hotel, but be careful where you/the valet parks your car!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: sharknes
Reviews.Content: this is pretty plain Jane, but good value for the money and a good location. I would stay here again, unlike the Sheraton Wall centre which should be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for waterfront”
Reviews.Author: mdpooh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Days Inn, Pender Street, for one night before taking the Rocky Mountaineer to Banff. Though the room was small it was comfortable and very well kept. The location is very convenient for visiting the waterfront area of Vancouver and is easy walking distance to Gastown as well. Extremely convenient for a pre-cruise stay. Hotel also provides a shuttle and staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, defininately not the worst”
Reviews.Author: OhioTravelinFools
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night because of the convenient location to the inner Pier where you embark on the cruises leaving from Vancouver. Its a walk away so no need to get a taxi to the pier. The staff was very friendly and helpful, but the hotel shows its age. They upgraded our room to a larger room, but even with that the room was so very small we could hardly set up our suitcase without tripping over it. The bathrooms are tiny, only room for one, and the shower quite cramped. For the location, it was ideal, but not somewhere I would suggest staying for more than one or 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: dforce
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights at the Days Inn downtown Vancouver. As I was travelling with a colleague, I booked a standard room with 2 double beds. The location is absolutely fantastic. Not only was I walking distance to the Float Plane terminal but I was also centrally located to the conference that I was attending at the Hyatt Regency. The cost of the room at the Days Inn was a fraction of the conference rate at the Hyatt. The rooms featured basic amenities but I was pleasantly surprised to find a flat screen TV and refrigerator with complimentary bottled water. The internet service is good and if you don't have your own computer, they have a complimentary business centre in the lobby. Service could use some improvement. Many of their staff left an indifferent taste in my mouth. However, the Asian female front desk clerk that checked me out was exceptional. The standard rooms with 2 double beds are somewhat small but I do know from other colleagues who booked the same room type that the hotel does have larger versions than the one I was booked into so don't hesitate to ask the Front Desk to move you to a larger room. Overall, it was a great stay and I would not hesitate to come back on future trips to Vancouver. For the price and location, it is tremendous value that cannot be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre in all respects”
Reviews.Author: bundledape
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the good: central downtown location, new flatscreen TVs. That's about it. The bad: Customer service is slow and indifferent. Rooms are small and views mostly non-existent (I had a tiny window that opened onto a brick wall). Room service and valet services are contracted out, meaning that things cannot be charged to the room and service quality is poor and bordering on rude. Food is pretty disappointing as well. Coming from a customer service background I usually have a pretty high tolerance for this kind of thing but I felt throughout my stay that they thought they were doing me a favour by letting me stay in their hotel. Can only assume this reflects a company that doesn't treat their staff particularly well. Overall, if you are looking for a place to crash and not spend much time in the hotel, you could do worse (ie. no rats/cockroaches, rooms in reasonably good repair/cleanliness). But if you are looking for a hotel you will enjoy, try the Pan Pacific, the Hotel Vancouver, or any one of about 50 other hotels in Vancouver where you are made to feel like a valued customer and guest. Will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable quality for the price”
Reviews.Author: kironb
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night (just under $150 AAA rate) while in town for business. The Good: - LCD or Plasma TV in room was excellent quality - Comfortable bed - Free bottled water - Conveniently located close to the client I was visiting - Helpful front desk staff - Reasonable office desk & chair The Bad: - Tiny room and even tinier bathroom - No towel bar to hang hand/face towels - Liquid soap dispenser in bathtub was empty - Toilet bowl had multiple cosmetic/hairline cracks - Internet access was down the morning I left

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Pre or Post Cruiise Stay”
Reviews.Author: keyscops
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed at this property after our Alaskan Cruise vacation before heading to the airport in vancouver and home. I was concerned about the reviews regarding the room size but I booked it anyway. Our ship came into Canada Place and the hotel is only a short 3 block walk with easy terrain. We were able to negotiate it with our luggage easily, The front desk staff was helpful and even arranged our taxi to the airport the following morning. I should have been concerned about the room size but after being in a cruise ship cabin for a week, the room was fine. Bedding was clean and good quality and the bathrooms were new and clean. The Hotel is located in what is predominately the business district so there are no restaurants open after 3 p.m. unless you walk to Canada Place or 7 blocks to Gastown one way or 7 blocks to Robson the other. Don't extect a view. Our 4th floor window opened to a brick wall!!!! The price was comprable to other hotels. This property had none of the shady characters in the properties such as Howard Johnsons.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: chrissmaz
Reviews.Content: This is a great inxpensive hotel. Rooms are small with not much of a view, BUT is VERY convenient to Cruise dock, restaurants, shopping, bus tours and is clean and neat with a decent restaurant. Cant beat the price!

Reviews.Title: “Don't book the standard room”
Reviews.Author: TacomaCoop
Reviews.Content: Do not book a "standard room" at this hotel. I found my room through hotwire. After checking in and realizing that my room was both cold and very susceptible to street noise, I was told that this is the same for all "standard rooms". FYI Standard rooms are 301-305, 401-405 etc on all floors. Night manager not helpful in making ammends. Will let you know if there is a change. On the pluses, Clean with nice flatscreen.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: ptpdx
Reviews.Content: My room came with 2 double beds. It was very clean, had AC, a refrigerator, iron/ironing board, flat panel TV. Very centrally located with one block to Canada Place, about a 15 minutes walk from Stanley Park, and 10 minutes from Robson Street. Our package also came with IMAX tickets; a nice treat, as well as a bar of chocolate. The staff were friendly and helpful. The bed was nicely firm and I slept well. The package also came with continental breakfast, which was prepared nicely. They do have valet parking, but I felt a bit misled. When we checked in, the lady told us parking was included, but when we checked out, of course, parking was on the bill I would stay here again. Reasonable price for downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Alaska cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: pls709
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights before our Alaska cruise. The hotel was centrally located and appeared to have been recently renovated. The hotel was in walking distance of the cruise ship and we met a family that walked to the pier on embarkation day rather than take the shuttle. The new flat screen TV's had been installed just days before we arrived. Probably the only thing that I could find to complain about is that they only have one small elevator for all 8 floors. We found it impossible for both of us to ride the elevator along with our luggage, had to take shifts. This was just a minor inconvenience for us. Someone else might find it intolerable, though. For those of us lugging a laptop along, there was free wi-fi in the rooms. There was a desktop available for use in the lobby for everyone else. The hotel provided complimentary shuttles to the cruise ship pier. There is a breakfast/lunch restaurant on the lowest floor that had very good food. Next door is an Irish pub with good food and cold beer. Unfortunately, the pub is not open on Sundays. Bedding and mattresses very comfy and of high quality. Overall, we were very happy with our stay at the Days Inn Downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: satBellevue
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for one night In Downtown Days Inn, at Pender st, Vancouver. When I checked-in I was told that I have booked 2 rooms for the same night. I tried to explain that I booked only one room and not 2. The front desk receptionist was not courteous at all. She insisted me to change it to 2 nights if i want to avoid charges for two rooms, was asked to talk to manager next day,but the next day the manager told me that they cannot give it for 2 nights as the booking I made was for 2 rooms the previous day and I have to pay again if I had to stay that night and told me i will be charged two rooms for same night though we only stayed in one room.We were Shocked after listening to him.I paid 142$ for a tiny room, with no breakfst and additional 17$ for parking. They have charged me additonal 142$ for the other room for the same night, would never stay in the hotel again and will not recommend to any of my Friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for city centre location”
Reviews.Author: amoose99
Reviews.Content: When searching for a city centre hotel in a city I've not visited before, I worry about three basic things: is the hotel in a bad area? is it noisy? is it clean? The Days Inn in Downtown vancouver meets those basic needs. It is reasonably priced for a downtown hotel (although tends away from budget to mid-range during the summer months). I have stayed here approximately twice a year for the past five years without problem. The basics: * Area: Vancouver has a very scary area; this hotel is comfortably outside of that area by 2-3 blocks. It is in the financial area so tends to be pretty dead in the evenings and weekends, but is safe. It is a few blocks to the nearest convenience store. * Noise: the street outside is not a particularly busy one, plus you'll probably be facing a wall on the side rather than the street. It is in the city centre though, so some minor traffic noise. I've very rarely heard noises from the corridor or other rooms. * Cleanliness: very good, never had a problem with the rooms, bathrooms or beds. But there are a few other things to know about this hotel: * Rooms are small, I mean SMALL. Not New York small, but not generous by any means. The bathrooms are tiny. * Most rooms look out the side of the building, straight onto a blank wall. You can just about see some sky if you look straight up. A few rooms at the front look out over the street, but these are a bit noisier (from the street) and lighter (from the giant yellow Days Inn sign). * Parking is but valet only, at about CAD$15/day. You can go in and out as much as you like, but this is not super convenient. * The elevator is tiny and slow. * Stairs wind around the elevator, so you end up walking much further than normal back-and-forth stair well, and even get a bit dizy. * TVs aren't very large, and have a strange, separate channel changer box (with remote). * Curtains are okay thinkness for keeping light out, but are absolutely minimal height so there is lots of light leaking in under the curtain. Normally to stop this in other hotels I push the curtain onto the window sill to keep out the light, but the curtains here only just reach the sill. Also they are cutout around the air conditioner (which is usually in the window). * No pull-in area outside the hotel, so when arriving by car just park on the street and run inside to check-in and give the keys to the valet. * No free breakfast It is not all bad though: * Safe area * Quiet * Clean * Walking distance to downtown attractions (gastown, cruise terminal, harbour tower, Robson street, Granville Street). * Very close to buses (on Burrard and Granville) * Very close to Skytrain (Burrard St) * In-room safe * Elevator requires room key (so a little bit more secure than hotels with open access to the room floors) * Valet parking is usually sufficiently quick to retreive cars, even when several people are leaving at the same time Overall, I recommend this hotel if you want to stay downtown at a more reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best stay”
Reviews.Author: Michimi
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and the size decent but it was way too expensive for what we received. The air conditioner didn't work well at all, we were quite hot and this was in April. I can't imagine what it would have been like in July. The rooms were a decent size but the beds were very uncomfortable. The better features are it's location (just two blocks from Robson and really close the the seawall), the free shuttle to downtown locations and the free continental breakfast. I feel I can get a comparable room for much cheaper than we paid here (189/night for 4 people). We probably could have paid a few more dollars and gotten a really nice room at a luxury hotel down the street!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: hokkaido
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was really great. I enjoyed walking around downtown. Although the hotel itself is pretty small and not new, but the room is neat, the bathroom is crean. Since I don't see many US hotels use comforters, I was so happy to sleep using a comforter. It was so warm and comfortable. And they also provide an umbrella in the closet. It was rainning sometimes, so the umbrella was very useful. The vallet parking is pretty expensive, $15 per day. And the front desk person charged us more than it was supposed to be. We soon noticed his mistake, and he corrected it though.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation not honored - don't go there”
Reviews.Author: loparm
Reviews.Content: After 12 exhausting hours of travel from the east coast of the U.S., our party of two couples in their 70's arrived at the Days Inn to be blatantly turned away, despite making reservations 3 months in advance and having reconfirmed the 4 night-reservation twice before arrival. The Mgr conveniently left early that day and put the uncomfortable burden of telling us there were no rooms available upon a young assistant, who did offer us accommodation at a sister hotel in the far-westside of Vancouver. Despite our dismay, there was no give and we ended up having to stay far away from our carefully chosen downtown location; this caused much wasted and tiring time reaching sightseeing sites. Don't take a risk - go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: prius
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on our first Canada holiday because of its situation, which is right in Downtown on a busy street. Rather old hotel. Room was rather small and notwithstanding the fact that I had reserved a room with more than one window and with a view, we got one with one small window only and no view at all. However the bed was Kingsize. Noisy airco. Staff helpfull but not over friendly. Frustrating was the breakfast special we had booked. We expected to get a free breakfast but "breakfast special" means that you can eat for $ 7,50 and above that you have to pay. Considering the prices, you won't get a lot for $ 7,50, so breakfast is not free at all. I made a comments about this "marketing-trick" but reaction of the staff was poor. Won't go again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, dungeon rooms”
Reviews.Author: gazzeruk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, within a couple of hundred yards of the Canada Centre. A number 19 trolley bus takes you directly to Stanley park. Most of the downtown attractions and eateries are within easy walking distance. The hotel is popular – it was full during our stay. The rooms are very small, no room to swing a cat. Ours had one double bed. Our window overlooked a concrete wall some 6 feet away, and virtually no natural light entered the room. The air conditioner was too noisy to use, however the room wasn’t too warm. The hotel has only one small lift, which also doubles a as a service lift for the porter, so it was very heavily used. Cleanliness was excellent. The little man on reception wasn’t over friendly, but all the other staff were helpful. I think the rates are expensive for what you get. We paid $160 CDN per night for our room, weekend in August 2005. We had breakfast in the restaurant one day, which served nice food, although expensive. They don’t do a buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Small noisy rooms, almost no windows”
Reviews.Author: ElenaA3
Reviews.Content: There is nothing to this hotel besides its location. Very small rooms (think a queen bed and just a little room to walk around it). Mine was also very noisy, on a corner, door by door with another room... woke up everytime the neighbors opened/closed their door. Oh, and the window -- a tiny one facing a grey grey wall, so I needed to turn the light on even on the day it was sunny outside. I was on a conference, and people staying in the surrounding hotels were paying more (+$70 per night) but the rooms were huge (compared to mine at least), nice windows, swimming pools etc... Will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at a great rate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Days Inn for two nights in August 2003, and we couldn't of picked a better place to stay. The room was very nice and we had a terrific view of the city, and the location was perfect, because you could walk to just about everything. The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful in assisting us with good selections of places to visit and dine. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rates at Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Days Inn, W. Pender St., Vancouver for four nights in September 2003. We were ushered into a large room with a king-size bed which by the way was very comfortable. The problem was there was no window in the room, just a small window in the bathroom. We were told that after two nights we could change to another room. The next morning I looked at the other rooms on our floor and saw that they were quite small. We stayed the entire time in the room we had. Everything worked fine. We were in the downtown area at very affordable rates. It was easy to walk almost anywhere. The room had a coffeemaker and a refrigerator. I would go back but would like a room with a window.

HotelInfo.Name: Days Inn Vancouver Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 921 W. Pender Street, Vancouver, British Columbia V6C 1M2, Canada
